name: Protect - One-Click Access
title: Protect - One-Click Access
body:
One-click access reduces friction for recipients of Secure Emails by allowing them to view the email content without needing to create an account or authenticate. Recipients will receive a notification email containing a unique access link, allowing them to view the email using the Secure Message Portal.

One-click access is not the recommended setup for optimal security practices. Anyone who gains access to the unique access link can view the email content. One-click access can only be configured by a KnowBe4 employee, so contact our support team to enable this feature.

Note: Recipients will have One-click Access to an email for 7 days. After this period expires, they will need to sign in or create an account to continue accessing the content.

Requirements

The requirements needed for this feature are listed below:

  • Gateway
  • Up-to-date Protect policies
  • Risk sign-off by customer

Workflow

The workflow of this feature is explained below:

  1. A secure email is sent.

  2. Selected recipients receive a notification email containing a unique access link.

  3. Upon clicking the Open Secure Email button, the recipient is taken to the secure email.

  4. When a recipient accesses the email, an entry in the Secure Email Audit Events is created, showing who and when the email was accessed.

  5. The sender of the secure email has full access controls and can easily revoke access when required.

This image displays a notification template from the Egress Secure Platform, centered on a white background.

**Branding and Context:**
*   A small header reads: "You have received an Egress secure platform notification."
*   The primary logo features a blue stylized 'G' or checkmark followed by the bold black text "egress."

**Primary Message and UI Elements:**
*   The headline text states: "You have received a new **secure email**," with the words "secure email" highlighted in an orange-brown color.
*   A line follows with "from" next to a large, light gray/purple redacted area, indicating the placeholder for the sender's identity.
*   The central Call to Action (CTA) is a prominent, rectangular, bright blue button labeled in white text: "Open secure email."

**Instructional Text and Alternatives:**
*   The notification provides two methods for accessing the message:
    1.  **Client Software:** "If you have **Egress software installed** just double click the email or attachment." ("Egress software installed" is highlighted in orange-brown).
    2.  **Web Reader:** "Alternatively, visit **https://reader.egress.com/** and insert the following code:" This is followed by a second redacted area (light gray/purple placeholder) for the unique access code.

**Security and Footer:**
*   A security advisory in bold text reminds the user: "Always check the links before you click and check the browser address bar for the padlock icon."
*   The main website URL, "**www.egress.com**," is displayed centrally.
*   The bottom of the template features a light blue horizontal bar containing support information: "Need support? Visit our support center at **www.egress.com/support** for more information." (The support URL is a blue hyperlink).
